thread.title: Trans-Siberian: highlights of the world's greatest rail journey
thread.title_full: Trans-Siberian: highlights of the world's greatest rail journey

author: Telegraph Staff
title: Trans-Siberian: highlights of the world's greatest rail journey
text:
MORE... 
1. The sheer scale of it 
Although there are longer routes, this is the one that captures the imagination and stands out as the ultimate rail journey . The Moscow to Vladivostok route covers 9,258km (6,152 miles), passes though eight time zones and takes seven days (unless you choose to break the journey with a stopover). Trainspotter heaven. There are two main variations on the route: the Trans-Mongolian (Moscow to Beijing via Ulan Bator) and the Trans-Manchurian (Moscow to Beijing via Harbin).
